snippet: Alberta’s oil sands industry has raised the levels of cancer-causing compounds in surrounding lakes well beyond natural levels, researchers reported.
abstract: Canadian researchers release government-financed study that finds development of Alberta's oil sands has increased levels of cancer-causing compounds in surrounding lakes well beyond natural levels, and that contamination covers wider area than had previously been believed; study is likely to provide further ammunition to critics of industry both in Canada and abroad.
lead_paragraph: Alberta’s oil sands industry has raised the levels of cancer-causing compounds in surrounding lakes well beyond natural levels, researchers reported.

headline.seo: Oil Sand Industry in Canada Tied to Higher Carcinogen Level
headline.main: Oil Sands Industry in Canada Tied to Higher Carcinogen Level
headline.print_headline:
Toxic Risk
Is Suggested
In a Study
Of Oil Sands
